entry.title: Summary of Type-I/II error and confusion matrix
entry.content: Today I found something interesting about the Type-I and Type-II error in hypothesis testing, and found a interesting similarities between this and confusion matrix in machine learning. In hypothesis testingwe define $H_0$ as the null hypothesis, and : Type-I error: reject $\mathbf{H_0}$ though it’s true Type-II error: not reject $\mathbf{H_0}$ though it’s not true for all scenarios:     Actual Situation     $H_0$ is true $H_0$ is NOT true Statistical Do NOT reject $H_0$ correct decision 1-$\alpha$ Type-II error $\beta$ Decision Reject $H_0$ Type-I error $\alpha$ correct decision (power) 1-$\beta$ Note: the power is to reject null hypothesis when it’s wrong In machine learningWhile for a binarized classification question (to judge whether it’s true or false), there is not always a consistency between prediciton and actual situation, where we have a confusion matrix:     Actual Situation     True False Prediction True true positive (TP) false positive (FP)   False false negative (FN) true negative (TN) There are some parameters you may often come across Parameters Formula Interpretation sensitivity, recall, or true positive rate (TPR) $\frac{TP}{TP+FN}$ ability to detect True specificity, selectivity or true negative rate (TNR) $\frac{TN}{TN+FP}$ ability to detect False false discovery rate (FDR) $\frac{FP}{TP+FP}$ misfound true precision $\frac{TP}{TP+FP}$ ratio of true positive in predicted positive Accuracy $\frac{TP+TN}{TP+TN+FP+FN}$ correct prediction in all prediction. note the difference between the sensitivity and precision, the former is how many positive you have detected in all positive, the latter is among all positive you predicted, how many is true. And the matthews correlation coefficient(MCC) is: $$ MCC = \frac{TP \times TN - FP \times FN}{\sqrt{(TP+FP)(TP+FN)(TN+FP)(TN+FN)}} $$ if plot the sensitivity over 1-specificity (plot true positive rate (TPR) against the false positive rate), we can get the Receiver Operating Characteristic curve (ROC). Similarities between these 2 topics also, he reminds me that if 1/3 is a finite decimal fraction when using the base of 3, which means that whether a decimal is a repeating decimal depends on the base it use.

entry.title: Markdown basics
entry.content: Markdown is suitable for documentation. This blog gives a introduction to basic writing skills in markdown. The contents are extracted from ref1, ref2, ref3, ref4. ShortcutsCtrl+Shift+V : a preview of Markdown code in HTML format. Press again to return to Markdown codeCtrl+Space : a context sensitive list of Markdown commands that can be used. eg: type “link”, and press Ctrl+Space to insert a hyperlink. Headeruse # to define header, the number of # corresponds to the rank of header 123## This is an tag### This is an <h3> tag###### This is an <h6> tag Alternatively, for H1 and H2, an underline-ish style: 12345Alt-H1======Alt-H2------ Fontuse * or _ to show italic font 12*This text will be italic* _This will also be italic_ This text will be italic use ** or __ to show bold font 12**This text will be bold** __This will also be bold__ This text will be bold 1_You **can** also combine them_ You can also combine them StrikethroughAny word wrapped with two tildes 1`~~this~~` like this, will appear crossed out. Ordered ListTo order your list, precede each line with a number. 123451. Item 12. Item 23. Item 3 1. Item 3a 1. Item 3b Item 1 Item 2 Item 3 Item 3a Item 3b Unordered Listuse - or *. 123456- Item 1* Item 2 * item 2a * item 2b1. Item a2. Item b Item 1 Item 2 item 2a item 2b Item a Item b Nested Listsusing the web editor on GitHub or a text editor that uses a monospaced font, create a nested list by indenting one or more list items below another item.note: the list marker character (- or *) lies must be directly below the first character of the text in the item above it. 1231. First list item - First nested list item - Second nested list item First list item First nested list item Second nested list item using non monospaced font? count the number of characters, add the same amount of spaces.for more infomation, please see GitHub Flavored Markdown Spec. Blockquotesquote txt with >123As Kanye West said:> We're living the future so> the present is our past. As Kanye West said: We’re living the future sothe present is our past. Quoting codecall out code or a command within a sentence with single backticks. 1use `git status` to... Use git status to list all new or modified files that haven’t yet been committed. To format code or text into its own distinct block, use triple backticks in the beginning and the end. Some basic Git commands are:123git statusgit addgit commit Linkshttp://github.com - use address directly, automatic forms the link!or create an inline link by wrapping link text in brackets [ ], and then wrapping the URL in parentheses ( ), you can also add a tag of the link (the words that appear when the mouse hangs over it), just use " " to embrace the tags after the link, the tag and the link are seperated by . 1[Github](http://github.com "github") GitHub Section linkslink directly to a section in a rendered file by hovering over the section heading to expose the link. 1[header](#header) header Relative linksdefine relative links and image paths to help navigate to other files in your repository,A relative link is a link that is relative to the current file. 1[Contribution guidelines for this project](docs/CONTRIBUTING.md) ImagesFormat:1![Alt Text](url) online: url is the address to the img local : url is the path to the img, eg: D:/用户目录/图片/MIT.jpg Tabledividing them with hyphens - (for the first row), and then separating each column with a pipe |: 1234First Header | Second Header------------ | -------------Content from cell 1 | Content from cell 2Content in the first column | Content in the second column First Header Second Header Content from cell 1 Content from cell 2 Content in the first column Content in the second column Task ListsTo create a task list, preface list items with [ ]. To mark a task as complete, use [x]. 12- [ ] this is an incomplete item- [x] this is a complete item this is an incomplete item this is a complete item @mentions, #refs, links, formatting, and tags supported list syntax required (any unordered or ordered list supported) it doesn’t work locally, why? for more information please see task lists Ignoring Markdown formattingusing \ before the Markdown character, like:\*\*look** means **look**
